decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the details submitted, full details of the proposed vehicular site access shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and the approved detail shall be completed prior to the first use of any part of the building hereby permitted.  REASON: To ensure an adequate and safe means of access and egress from the site is available in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety and in pursuance of policies policies T2, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) 1.1(g) and 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Nine wheelchair accessible hotel bedrooms shall be provided unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any part of the hotel and these rooms shall be retained as such thereafeter.  REASON: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy E10 of the London Plan (2021). | No external access shall be gained to the top of the building except for the purposes of essential servicing and maintenance and for no other purpose. Further, no additional plant, air conditioning or satellite dishes shall be erected on any part of the roof of the approved building.  REASON: To protect the privacy, outlook and living conditions of neighbouring properties and to preserve the visual appearance of the area in accordance with policy 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the access arrangements detailed on the plans hereby approved, prior to commencement of development, satisfactory details of wheelchair access within the site shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall proceed in accordance with the details as approved, and be retained as such thereafter.    REASON:  To ensure that the development provides adequate access arrangements for wheelchair users in accordance with policy E10 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of any contamination, and the approved remedial works shall be implemented before building works commence in the interests of occupiers of neighbouring sites.  REASON: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Servicing for the hotel and offices shall only take place between the hours of 7.00am and 7.00pm Monday's to Saturdays and not at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.  REASON: In the interests of amenities of the occupiers of the residential properties at neighbouring sites in accordance with 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.5 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to the commencement of any development, details of a site construction method statement/management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  -    on-site construction worker parking  -    anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site  -    delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods)  -    dust suppression measures  -   site security  -   vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear  -     details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices  -   procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  REASON:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and T2, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 and the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting those Orders with or without modification), the bar and restaurant use on part of the ground floor of the development shall only be used as an ancillary function to the hotel use and for no other purpose, including retail purposes or a separate use.  REASON: To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, to protect the vitality and viability of the Ealing shopping centre and the amenity of the surrounding area in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.5 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Details of crime prevention and security measures for the buildings, car parking areas, cycle parking areas (including access controls to the car park and entrance doors), hard and soft landscaped areas and bin storage areas, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The details shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Metropolitan Police requirements of Secured By Design.  The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the amenities of occupiers of properties within the area, in accordance with policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and D11 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to commencement of development, details of the sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development hereby approved, as set out in the Energy Statement, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority.  The submitted details of sustainability measures shall include:  +     Wet centralised chiller plant for the data centre;  +   Roof top mounted photovoltaic panels generating a minimum of 26kWp;  +   Either heat recovery and reuse from the data centre chiller plant or a gas fired CHP for the hotel element of the scheme hereby approved;  +   Use of semi permeable surfacing for access paths and car parking areas within the site and demonstration of effective slow release of water from this material to vegetated areas.The submitted details shall demonstrate that the development hereby approved will achieve a minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions of 20% from on site renewable energy generation, and that the scheme will achieve a minimum BREAAM rating of very good.    The development shall proceed in accordance with the approved details and the approved sustainability measures shall be implemented and operational prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained and maintained in accordance with the manufacturers specification thereafter.    REASON:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SI2 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the information indicated on the submitted plans, fitting out of the restaurant shall not take place until full details of the installation and operation of the best practicable odour abatement equipment and the height of the exhaust stack for the restaurant, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first use of the restaurant and permanently retained and maintained in accordance with the manufacturers specification thereafter.  Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policy 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of construction, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery of the development hereby approved, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  REASON.  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise or vibration from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Details of measures for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) of the offices and hotel from external noise, vibration and odour, including aircraft noise and internal separation between the ground floor refuse storage area and the remainder of the building, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the amenities of office workers and of future occupiers of the hotel units, in accordance with policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the Green Travel Plan submitted with the application, a more detailed Green Travel Plan including targets shall be submitted to and approved in writing, prior to the occupation of the proposal hereby permitted and this approved Green Travel Plan shall be implemented as agreed, and be permanently retained and targets within the Plan shall be subject to monitoring by the Local Planning Authority on an annual basis or timetable as otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.   REASON: To promote the use of modes of transport, other than use of private motor vehicles, in pursuance of policies D3, T2, T3, T4, T6.2 and T6.4 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application, detailed drawings to show 14 car parking spaces for the approved offices and hotel uses set out to disabled space standard, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences and the details so approved shall be implemented before first occupation of any of the offices or hotel and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies T2, T3, T4, T6.2 and T6.4 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) 1.1(g) and 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, details shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority to specify the division of the car parking spaces between the hotel and data centre.  The car parking spaces and associated access areas shall be formed, marked out on the site and available for use in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking, and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies T2, T3, T4, T6.2 and T6.4 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) 1.1(g) and 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | The cycle parking shown on the approved plans shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy D4, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers 'Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution' and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, shall be submitted in writing to, and approved by, the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to first use of the buildings and be maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the area, in accordance with policy 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples and/or detailed information of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4, 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding the details submitted on MZ01_P-010 Rev E of ref. P/2008/3284, first occupation of the development hereby approved shall not take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works to the Uxbridge Road frontage, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season of this prominent site alongside one of the main traffic routes in the Town Centre.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and is pedestrian friendly in accordance with policies Policy D4, D8, G5, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies Policy D4, D8, G5, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Details of the works necessary to protect the trees to be retained within and adjacent to the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be implemented prior to commencement of the development and retained until it is completed.  No materials, plant, other equipment, storage or other works shall take place at any time within the enclosed area around the trees to be retained.  REASON: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies Policy D4, D8, G5, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | First occupation of the development hereby approved shall not take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (including any acoustic treatment adjacent to residential site boundaries, internal fences, walls and railings to the proposed roof areas) to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to first occupation of the approved development and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013). | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, an Air Quality Assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to determine the effect of the development on air quality and the exposure of future occupants to air pollutants, and any remedial measures necessary to achieve a satisfactory standard of air quality shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To prevent the pollution of the local environment and in the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies D6 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021). | The building hereby approved shall only be used for a hotel with ancillary bar and restaurant and for the office use described in the planning application as defined respectively within Classes C1 and E of the Town and Country Planning (Use Class) Order 1987 (as amended) and for no other purpose including any other use within the respective use classes unless planning permission has first been obtained via the submission of a planning application.   REASON:  To ensure that no separate or alternative uses commence without prior consideration of the planning issues in the interests of safeguarding the amenities of the locality, the conditions of highway safety and free flow of traffic on the neighbouring highways and to accord with 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.5 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and GG1, GG2, GG3, D3, T2, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021). | The ancillary bar and restaurant use hereby permitted within the ground-floor of the hotel shall not operate outside the hours of 0600 - 00.30hrs Monday to Sunday, including Bank and Public Holidays.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.5 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | First occupation of the development hereby approved shall not take place until details of servicing and refuse and recycling collection arrangements have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details shall include a refuse management plan that prevents occupants from siting at any time refuse and/or recycling bins on any road frontage.  Refuse and recycling collection shall not take place between the hours of 2200 and 0700 on any day.  The approved arrangements shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure suitable loading, unloading and refuse collection arrangements are provided within the site in order to ensure pedestrian and highway safety and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and the visual amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): 23-013-E01 (LOCATION PLAN); 23-013-P02 (PROPOSED GROUND FLOOR PLAN); 23-013-P03 (PROPOSED FIRST FLOOR PLAN); 23-013-P04 (PROPOSED SECOND FLOOR PLAN); 23-013-P05 (PROPOSED THIRD FLOOR PLAN); 23-013-P06 (PROPOSED FOURTH FLOOR PLAN); 23-013-P07 (PROPOSED FIFTH FLOOR PLAN); 23-013-P09 (PROPOSED ROOF PLAN); 23-013-P10 (PROPOSED FRONT ELEVATION); 23-013-P11 (PROPOSED SIDE ELEVATION); 23-013-P12 (PROPOSED REAR ELEVATION); 23-013-P13 (PROPOSED SIDE ELEVATION); PLANNING DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT (DATED APRIL 2023).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no. 29 (as inserted by non-material amendment Ref PP/2015/3100) pursuant to planning permission reference P/2008/3284 Dated 13.01.2009 "Erection of part 5, 6 and 9 storey building with mezzanine floor and basement to form 165 bed hotel with ancillary restaurant/bar and 3434 square metres of B1(a) data centre/office accommodation; alteration to western vehicular access and closure of eastern vehicular access; provision of 39 car parking spaces (including 14 disabled spaces); cycle parking, loading bay and associated landscaping". Variation seeks to incorporate a lift shaft to the eastern elevation.
